h1: How Many Calories Are in a New York Strip?
assumptions: Boneless, trimmed of visible fat, cooked (grilled or broiled); standard serving size ~200g.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by cut, fat content, cooking method, and exact weight. Check labels or use a food scale for precision.

quick_answer.text: A New York strip steak (~200g cooked, lean) provides about 412 kcal and 60 g protein.

basis.label: per 1 New York strip steak (200g cooked)

faqs.q: How many calories are in a New York strip steak?
faqs.a: About 412 kcal for a 200g cooked, lean serving.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a New York strip?
faqs.a: Approximately 60 g protein per 200g cooked steak.

faqs.q: Does cooking method affect calories in New York strip?
faqs.a: Yes; grilling or broiling keeps it lower than frying, which adds fat.

faqs.q: How much fat is in a New York strip steak?
faqs.a: Around 18 g total fat, including 8 g saturated, for a 200g lean cooked portion.

faqs.q: Are New York strips high in cholesterol?
faqs.a: Yes, about 180 mg per 200g serving, mostly from the meat itself.
